title: Variables
summary: Variables store values so you can reuse and update them during a program. You can think of a variable as a labeled box that holds a value, like a number or a piece of text.
sample_question: What is a variable and why is it useful in programming?

title: Loops
summary: Loops let you repeat an action multiple times without copying the same code. For example, you can loop over a list of items or repeat something until a condition is met.
sample_question: Explain the difference between a for loop and a while loop.

title: Conditions
summary: Conditions let your program make decisions. Using if/else statements, the program can choose different paths depending on whether something is true or false.
sample_question: How does an if-else statement decide which block of code to run?
